snippet: From crows that stick pellets of dung in deer ears, to robins that can hear for worms, two new books offer remarkable stories and insight on the winged creatures.
abstract: James Gorman reviews books Gifts of the Crow: How Perception, Emotion and Thought Allow Smart Birds to Behave Like Humans by John N Marzluff and Tony Angell and Bird Sense: What It's Like to Be a Bird by Tim Birkhead.
lead_paragraph: From crows that stick pellets of dung in deer ears, to robins that can hear for worms, two new books offer remarkable stories and insight on the winged creatures.

headline.print_headline: The Games Crows Play, and Other Winged Tales
headline.seo: ‘Gifts of the Crow’ and ‘Bird Sense’: The Lives of the Winged Set
headline.main: The Games Crows Play, and Other Winged Tales
